org.jacktheclipper.frontend.controller

Class UserConfigController

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jacktheclipper.frontend.controller.UserConfigController

  • @Controller
 @RequestMapping(value="/{organization}/feed")
public class UserConfigController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class covers all pages that a normal user needs to edit his settings. This includes adding new feeds and modifying his notification settings.

    • Method Detail

      • editFeed

        @GetMapping(value="/edit")
 @PreAuthorize(value="hasRole(\'ROLE_USER\')")
public java.lang.String editFeed(@RequestParam(value="feedId",required=false)
                                                                                                             java.util.UUID feedId,
                                                                                                             org.springframework.security.core.Authentication auth,
                                                                                                             org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        Shows the page where a user can edit his feeds. By default the first feed in the users feed is automatically selected (or an entirely new feed if the user has none).
        Parameters:
        feedId - The feed the user wants to edit. This overrides the default behaviour and automatically loads the feed matching this id (or a new feed if the user does not have a feed matching that id)
        auth - The user wishing to edit his feeds
        model -
        Returns:
        The page where a user can edit his feeds

      • updateFeed

        @PostMapping(value="/update")
 @PreAuthorize(value="hasRole(\'ROLE_USER\')")
public java.lang.String updateFeed(@ModelAttribute(value="feed")
                                                                                                                  Feed feed,
                                                                                                                  org.springframework.security.core.Authentication auth,
                                                                                                                  @RequestParam(value="settingsId")
                                                                                                                  java.util.UUID settingsId,
                                                                                                                  @PathVariable(value="organization")
                                                                                                                  java.lang.String organization,
                                                                                                                  org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirectAttributes)
        Processes a users's edits to his feeds. This includes updating already existing ones or adding entirely new ones
        Parameters:
        feed - The updated feed. This feed is only used if addRequest is not present or false
        settingsId - The settings the feed should be added to
        organization - The organization the user belongs to. This parameter just needs to be bound somewhere in the controller, so Spring is capable of matching paths correctly. It could also be extracted by calling User.getOrganization()
        auth - The user trying to change his feed
        redirectAttributes -
        Returns:
        The page where a user can edit his feeds

      • addFeed

        @PostMapping(value="/addFeed")
 @PreAuthorize(value="hasRole(\'ROLE_USER\')")
public java.lang.String addFeed(@ModelAttribute(value="emptyFeed")
                                                                                                                Feed feed,
                                                                                                                org.springframework.security.core.Authentication auth,
                                                                                                                @RequestParam(value="settingsId")
                                                                                                                java.util.UUID settingsId,
                                                                                                                @PathVariable(value="organization")
                                                                                                                java.lang.String organization,
                                                                                                                org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirectAttributes)
        Adds a feed to the supplied UserSettings via their UUID
        Parameters:
        feed - The feed that should be added
        auth - The user adding the feed
        settingsId - The id of the UserSettings the Feed should be added to
        organization - The organization the user belongs to
        redirectAttributes -
        Returns:
        The page where a user can edit his feeds

        @PostMapping(value="/remove")
 @PreAuthorize(value="hasRole(\'ROLE_USER\')")
public java.lang.String removeFeed(@RequestParam(value="feedId")
                                                                                                                  java.util.UUID feedId,
                                                                                                                  org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirectAttributes,
                                                                                                                  @PathVariable(value="organization")
                                                                                                                  java.lang.String organization)
        Deletes the supplied feed
        Parameters:
        feedId - The UUID of the Feed that should be deleted
        redirectAttributes -
        organization - The organization the user belongs to
        Returns:
        The page where a user can edit his feeds

      • profile

        @GetMapping(value="/profile")
public java.lang.String profile(org.springframework.ui.Model model,
                                                               org.springframework.security.core.Authentication auth)
        Shows a user's profile settings. This includes information about everything except his feeds. Included are e. g. settings about notification intervals.
        Parameters:
        model -
        auth - The user wishing to see his settings and maybe update them
        Returns:
        A page showing the settings

      • updateProfile

        @PostMapping(value="/profile")
public java.lang.String updateProfile(@ModelAttribute(value="settings")
                                                                      UserSettings settings,
                                                                      @RequestParam(value="settingsId")
                                                                      java.util.UUID settingsId,
                                                                      @PathVariable(value="organization")
                                                                      java.lang.String organization,
                                                                      org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirectAttributes)
        Processes a user's request to update his settings
        Parameters:
        settings - The (possibly changed) settings of the user
        settingsId - The id of the userSettings
        organization - The organization the user belongs to
        redirectAttributes -
        Returns:
        The page about the user's profile

      • login

        private void login(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                   User user)
        Logs the user into the session. This is duplicated code from RegistrationController#login(HttpServletRequest, User) but it will be removed from there soon as being logged in after registering will not be supported in the final version anymore
        Parameters:
        request - the http-request holding the http session
        user - the user to authenticate
